result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus F Finch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus F Finch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Marcus F Finch.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 03/02/2023. Any non standard documents or motions to be filed by 02/23/2023, with any reply due by 03/02/2023. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16.
Jury trial scheduled for March 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus F Finch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Marcus F Finch.  Attorney Patrick Franken appeared in court on behalf of Amy E Spanczak for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel provides an update to the court. Due to reasons put forth on the record, Court adjourns matter for an additional status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus F Finch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Marcus F Finch.  Attorney Annie Louk for Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus F Finch in court, appear by video with attorney Sylvan Jaspen, appear by video.  Defendant Marcus F Finch in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Maldonado.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus F Finch in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Marcus F Finch in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Sylvan Jaspen

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Marcus F Finch in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Marcus F Finch in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcus F Finch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
